title: Secondo uno studio dell'università di Urbino l'algoritmo di Facebook ora punisce la politica ufficiale e premia gli estremisti antieuropei. Pd e FdI verso una legge bipartisan sulle piattaforme - Open
snippet: A study published by the University of Urbino, authored by Professor Fabio Giglietto, analyzes the effects of Meta's algorithmic choices on the distribution and visibility of political content on Facebook. The study reveals significant transparency deficits and indicates that the algorithmic suppression is less effective against extremists. The research analyzed over 2.5 million Facebook posts published between 2021 and 2025.
description: An article from open.online discusses a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino about the impact of Facebook's algorithms on political content, revealing transparency deficits and potential biases toward extremist content.

title: Secondo uno studio dell'università di Urbino l'algoritmo di Facebook ora punisce la politica ufficiale e premia gli estremisti antieuropei. Pd e FdI verso una legge bipartisan sulle piattaforme
snippet: A study by the University of Urbino, authored by Professor Fabio Giglietto, analyzes the effects of Meta's algorithmic choices on the distribution and visibility of political content on Facebook. The study highlights transparency deficits, noting that algorithmic suppression is less effective against extremists. The research analyzed over 2.5 million Facebook posts between 2021 and 2025.
description: This article on open.online discusses a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino that analyzes the impact of Facebook's algorithms on political content, specifically regarding disinformation and the visibility of extremist viewpoints.

Meet the speakers! - EUDTP 2025 - EuroTech Universities Alliance
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is listed as a speaker at the EuroTech Universities Alliance EUDTP 2025 event. He is described as a Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, researching disinformation dynamics and computational methods for detecting manipulation campaigns. He will be speaking on Implementation challenges and opportunities under DSA.
description: Fabio Giglietto is a speaker at the EuroTech Universities Alliance EUDTP 2025 event, where he will discuss implementation challenges and opportunities under the DSA, drawing upon his expertise in disinformation dynamics and computational methods for detecting manipulation campaigns.

title: Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article introduces Fabio Giglietto as the leader of the Uniurb team within the vera.ai project. The team coordinates Work Package 4 (WP4), which focuses on discovering potentially problematic content in near-real-time using a content-agnostic approach, specifically addressing coordinated sharing behavior.
description: This article introduces Fabio Giglietto as the leader of the Uniurb team within the vera.ai project, which focuses on identifying problematic content in near-real-time by analyzing coordinated sharing behavior.
